ovdesc.p: This file stores details of Contract specific documents tracked for customers, in all applications other than CUSTOMER.
When a transaction is authorized, Contract specific documents tracked for it would be created by T24 in this application. Users also could create or modify the records in this application.
Records of this application could not be reversed.
When a transaction is reversed in an application, its related documents in this application would be reversed by T24.

desc.p: T24 maintained field.
Date of last update to the record.
Standard T24 date format.

t.desc:
Specifies the expiry date in case of a document with a valid status. The document would be valid till the date specified here and would expire afterwards.
If for a valid document, this field is not specified (Null), then the document would be valid for ever with no expiry date.
In case a document is invalid, this field conveys no special meaning for processing; for invalid documents it might be used to set up a date for reminder purposes. For example, in case a document is not received (an invalid status) and a reminder is sent to the customer, this field might be used to specify a date on which a chaser has to be sent to the customer.
T24 would not update the value of this field for documents with an invalid status, exception being when a document is created by T24 with a Status 1 (based on User Confirmation of YES to T24 confirmation message: "Have you received...."), irrespective of whether Status 1 is valid or invalid. For invalid documents, user might input any date greater than or equal to Bank date.
T24 would calculate the value of this field for documents as follows:
1. As per the definition of document validity in the record with ID equal to attached status (Field STATUS) in the file DOCUMENT.STATUS.
2. As per the definition of document validity in the record with ID equal to the value of Document Type (specified in the first part of ID) in the file DOCUMENT.TYPE.
3. The calculated END.DATE would be the least of the dates calculated as per 1 and 2 above.
User could override a T24 calculated END.DATE with a lesser date.

desc.p: Specifies the expiry date in case of a next document (document to replace the current one).
T24 would not calculate the value of this field, if the next document is with an invalid status (Field: NEXT.STATUS).
T24 would calculate the value of this field, if the next document is with a valid status, as follows:
1. As per document validity defined in the record with ID equal to attached status (Field: NEXT.STATUS), in the file DOCUMENT.STATUS.
2. As per document validity defined in the record with ID equal to value of Document Type (specified in the first part of ID), in the file DOCUMENT.TYPE.
3. The calculated NEXT.END.DATE would be the least of the dates calculated as per 1 and 2 above.
User could override a T24 calculated NEXT.END.DATE with a lesser date.
Optional.
Standard T24 date format.
Value allowed only if NEXT.STATUS is specified.
If NEXT.STATUS is invalid, it is optional; if specified, it must be greater than or equal to the Bank Date.
If NEXT.STATUS is valid, then calculated or user input NEXT.END.DATE, if not null, should be greater than or equal to NEXT.EFF.DATE.

t.desc:
Specifies the mandatory
future effective date of
a next document (document to replace the current one), with a valid status.
When a next document is obtained from a Customer before the expiry of the current one, it could be made immediately effective, by directly updating the fields for the current document i.e. REFERENCE.NO to DOC.SEQUENCE
However, if the next document is with a valid status (Field: NEXT.STATUS is valid), then it would be possible to make it effective from any future date.
If the status of the next document is valid (Field: NEXT.STATUS is valid), on the start-of-day of its effective date, T24 would update the details of the current document with that of the next one as follows: STATUS by NEXT.STATUS, STATUS.DATE by NEXT.STATUS.DATE, END.DATE by NEXT.END.DATE, STAT.DETAILS by NEXT.DETAILS, SIG.DATE by NEXT.SIG.DATE; also the DOC.SEQUENCE would be incremented by 1.
Validation Rules:
Value allowed only if the status of the next document (Field: NEXT.STATUS) is specified.
Value not allowed if the status of the next document (Field: NEXT.STATUS) is invalid.
Value mandatory if the status of the next document (Field: NEXT.STATUS) is valid.
If specified, its value should be greater than Bank Date.

Validation Rules:
Optional.

desc.p: This file stores details of contract specific documents tracked for customers.

Format of the ID must be "Customer ID.* Application Mnemonic * Transaction ID * Document Type ID", where the first part refers to the ID of a valid CUSTOMER record, second part refers to the Mnemonic of an application (field APPLN.MNEMONIC in DM.APPLICATION.INFO), third part refers to the ID of a valid record in the application, and the last part refers to the ID of a valid DOCUMENT.TYPE record.
Value of the last part of ID (DOCUMENT.TYPE) would be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE) of a Document with valid status.
Records in this file cannot be reversed.
First part of the ID should be the ID of a valid CUSTOMER record.
Second part of the ID should be a valid value of the field APPLN.MNEMONIC in DM.APPLICATION.INFO for an application.
Third part must be the ID of a valid record in the application referred to in the second part.
Last part must be the ID of a valid DOCUMENT.TYPE record.
Value of the field CONTRACT.SPECIFC in the relevant DOCUMENT.TYPE record should be YES.
Specifies the status of the document.
Value of this field would be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE), of a Document with valid status.
T24 would update the value of this field to 3 ("Expired") at Batch processing on Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE), if this field refers to a valid status.
Mandatory field.
Should be the ID of a valid record in the file DOCUMENT.STATUS.

t.desc:
When the document record is updated by
T24, this field specifies the transaction reference number of the application,
from which T24 is updating it.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory if LAST.UPD.APPLN is specified.
Value not allowed if LAST.UPD.APPLN is not specified.
If specified, its value should be same as the Transaction ID which forms a part of the record ID.

desc.p: Specifies the date from which the document is tracked in T24.
For information purposes only.
No input field.

Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Specifies the sequence number of a document, to distinguish a new document obtained on expiry of the original one.
Mandatory.
Input allowed only when one of the fields STATUS or STATUS.DATE is updated.
Value could be updated only in increments of 1.
Specifies the status of the next document (document to replace the current one).

This might be used to specify user defined status such as "Advice sent", etc. for the next document, when an advice is sent to the customer for a new document, before the expiry of the current one. It might also represent the status of the next document which might have been obtained from the Customer before the expiry of the current one, and which could be effective from a future date.
Value of this field would be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: NEXT.END.DATE) of the Next Document, if it has a valid status.

On the End-of-day of the current document expiry (Field: END.DATE), if the next document is with an invalid status and its end date (Field:NEXT.END.DATE) is either null or not less than next working day, then T24 would update the current document details with that of the next one. i.e. the fields
STATUS by NEXT.STATUS, STATUS.DATE by NEXT.STATUS.DATE, END.DATE by NEXT.END.DATE, STAT.DETAILS by NEXT.DETAILS, SIG.DATE by NEXT.SIG.DATE; also the DOC.SEQUENCE would be incremented by 1.
Mandatory field.
Should be the ID of a valid record in the file DOCUMENT.STATUS.
Value of 3 ("Expired") not allowed.

Value of this field might be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE), of a Document with valid status.
